regs.name: INTR_STATE
regs.desc: Interrupt State Register

fields.name: TX_WATERMARK
fields.desc: raised if the transmit FIFO is past the high-water mark.

fields.name: RX_WATERMARK
fields.desc: raised if the receive FIFO is past the high-water mark.

fields.name: TX_DONE
fields.desc: raised if the transmit FIFO has emptied and no transmit is ongoing.

fields.name: RX_OVERFLOW
fields.desc: raised if the receive FIFO has overflowed.

fields.name: RX_FRAME_ERR
fields.desc: raised if a framing error has been detected on receive.

fields.name: RX_BREAK_ERR
fields.desc: raised if break condition has been detected on receive.

fields.name: RX_TIMEOUT
fields.desc: raised if RX FIFO has characters remaining in the FIFO without beingretrieved for the programmed time period.

fields.name: RX_PARITY_ERR
fields.desc: raised if the receiver has detected a parity error.

fields.name: TX_EMPTY
fields.desc: raised if the transmit FIFO is empty.

regs.name: INTR_ENABLE
regs.desc: Interrupt Enable Register

fields.name: TX_WATERMARK
fields.desc: Enable interrupt when !!INTR_STATE.tx_watermark is set.

fields.name: RX_WATERMARK
fields.desc: Enable interrupt when !!INTR_STATE.rx_watermark is set.

fields.name: TX_DONE
fields.desc: Enable interrupt when !!INTR_STATE.tx_done is set.

fields.name: RX_OVERFLOW
fields.desc: Enable interrupt when !!INTR_STATE.rx_overflow is set.

fields.name: RX_FRAME_ERR
fields.desc: Enable interrupt when !!INTR_STATE.rx_frame_err is set.

fields.name: RX_BREAK_ERR
fields.desc: Enable interrupt when !!INTR_STATE.rx_break_err is set.

fields.name: RX_TIMEOUT
fields.desc: Enable interrupt when !!INTR_STATE.rx_timeout is set.

fields.name: RX_PARITY_ERR
fields.desc: Enable interrupt when !!INTR_STATE.rx_parity_err is set.

fields.name: TX_EMPTY
fields.desc: Enable interrupt when !!INTR_STATE.tx_empty is set.

regs.name: INTR_TEST
regs.desc: Interrupt Test Register

fields.name: TX_WATERMARK
fields.desc: Write 1 to force !!INTR_STATE.tx_watermark to 1.

fields.name: RX_WATERMARK
fields.desc: Write 1 to force !!INTR_STATE.rx_watermark to 1.

fields.name: TX_DONE
fields.desc: Write 1 to force !!INTR_STATE.tx_done to 1.

fields.name: RX_OVERFLOW
fields.desc: Write 1 to force !!INTR_STATE.rx_overflow to 1.

fields.name: RX_FRAME_ERR
fields.desc: Write 1 to force !!INTR_STATE.rx_frame_err to 1.

fields.name: RX_BREAK_ERR
fields.desc: Write 1 to force !!INTR_STATE.rx_break_err to 1.

fields.name: RX_TIMEOUT
fields.desc: Write 1 to force !!INTR_STATE.rx_timeout to 1.

fields.name: RX_PARITY_ERR
fields.desc: Write 1 to force !!INTR_STATE.rx_parity_err to 1.

fields.name: TX_EMPTY
fields.desc: Write 1 to force !!INTR_STATE.tx_empty to 1.

regs.name: CTRL
regs.desc: UART control register

fields.name: TX
fields.desc: TX enable

fields.name: RX
fields.desc: RX enable

fields.name: NF
fields.desc: RX noise filter enable.If the noise filter is enabled, RX line goes through the 3-taprepetition code. It ignores single IP clock period noise.

fields.name: SLPBK
fields.desc: System loopback enable.If this bit is turned on, any outgoing bits to TX are received through RX.See Block Diagram. Note that the TX line goes 1 if System loopback is enabled.

fields.name: LLPBK
fields.desc: Line loopback enable.If this bit is turned on, incoming bits are forwarded to TX for testing purpose.See Block Diagram. Note that the internal design sees RX value as 1 always if lineloopback is enabled.

fields.name: PARITY_EN
fields.desc: If true, parity is enabled in both RX and TX directions.

fields.name: PARITY_ODD
fields.desc: If PARITY_EN is true, this determines the type, 1 for odd parity, 0 for even.

fields.name: RXBLVL
fields.desc: Trigger level for RX break detection. Sets the number of charactertimes the line must be low to detect a break.

fields.name: NCO
fields.desc: BAUD clock rate control.

regs.name: STATUS
regs.desc: UART live status register

fields.name: TXFULL
fields.desc: TX buffer is full

fields.name: RXFULL
fields.desc: RX buffer is full

fields.name: TXEMPTY
fields.desc: TX FIFO is empty

fields.name: TXIDLE
fields.desc: TX FIFO is empty and all bits have been transmitted

fields.name: RXIDLE
fields.desc: RX is idle

fields.name: RXEMPTY
fields.desc: RX FIFO is empty

regs.name: RDATA
regs.desc: UART read data

regs.name: WDATA
regs.desc: UART write data

regs.name: FIFO_CTRL
regs.desc: UART FIFO control register

fields.name: RXRST
fields.desc: RX fifo reset. Write 1 to the register resets RX_FIFO. Read returns 0

fields.name: TXRST
fields.desc: TX fifo reset. Write 1 to the register resets TX_FIFO. Read returns 0

fields.name: RXILVL
fields.desc: Trigger level for RX interrupts. If the FIFO depth is greater than or equal tothe setting, it raises rx_watermark interrupt.

fields.name: TXILVL
fields.desc: Trigger level for TX interrupts. If the FIFO depth is less than the setting, itraises tx_watermark interrupt.

regs.name: FIFO_STATUS
regs.desc: UART FIFO status register

fields.name: TXLVL
fields.desc: Current fill level of TX fifo

fields.name: RXLVL
fields.desc: Current fill level of RX fifo

regs.name: OVRD
regs.desc: TX pin override control. Gives direct SW control over TX pin state

fields.name: TXEN
fields.desc: Enable TX pin override control

fields.name: TXVAL
fields.desc: Write to set the value of the TX pin

regs.name: VAL
regs.desc: UART oversampled values

fields.name: RX
fields.desc: Last 16 oversampled values of RX. Most recent bit is bit 0, oldest 15.

regs.name: TIMEOUT_CTRL
regs.desc: UART RX timeout control

fields.name: VAL
fields.desc: RX timeout value in UART bit times

fields.name: EN
fields.desc: Enable RX timeout feature

regs.name: INTR_STATE
regs.desc: Interrupt State Register

fields.name: FMT_THRESHOLD
fields.desc: host mode interrupt: asserted whilst the FMT FIFO level is below the low threshold. This is a level status interrupt.

fields.name: RX_THRESHOLD
fields.desc: host mode interrupt: asserted whilst the RX FIFO level is above the high threshold. This is a level status interrupt.

fields.name: ACQ_THRESHOLD
fields.desc: target mode interrupt: asserted whilst the ACQ FIFO level is above the high threshold. This is a level status interrupt.

fields.name: RX_OVERFLOW
fields.desc: host mode interrupt: raised if the RX FIFO has overflowed.

fields.name: CONTROLLER_HALT
fields.desc: host mode interrupt: raised if the controller FSM is halted, such as on an unexpected NACK or lost arbitration.Check !!CONTROLLER_EVENTS for the reason.The interrupt will be released when the bits in !!CONTROLLER_EVENTS are cleared.

fields.name: SCL_INTERFERENCE
fields.desc: host mode interrupt: raised if the SCL line drops early (not supported without clock synchronization).

fields.name: SDA_INTERFERENCE
fields.desc: host mode interrupt: raised if the SDA line goes low when host is trying to assert high

fields.name: STRETCH_TIMEOUT
fields.desc: host mode interrupt: raised if target stretches the clock beyond the allowed timeout period

fields.name: SDA_UNSTABLE
fields.desc: host mode interrupt: raised if the target does not assert a constant value of SDA during transmission.

fields.name: CMD_COMPLETE
fields.desc: host and target mode interrupt.In host mode, raised if the host issues a repeated START or terminates the transaction by issuing STOP.In target mode, raised if the external host issues a STOP or repeated START.

fields.name: TX_STRETCH
fields.desc: target mode interrupt: raised if the target is stretching clocks for a read command. This is a level status interrupt.

fields.name: TX_THRESHOLD
fields.desc: target mode interrupt: asserted whilst the TX FIFO level is below the low threshold. This is a level status interrupt.

fields.name: ACQ_STRETCH
fields.desc: target mode interrupt: raised if the target is stretching clocks due to full ACQ FIFO or zero count in !!TARGET_ACK_CTRL.NBYTES (if enabled). This is a level status interrupt.

fields.name: UNEXP_STOP
fields.desc: target mode interrupt: raised if STOP is received without a preceding NACK during an external host read.

fields.name: HOST_TIMEOUT
fields.desc: target mode interrupt: raised if the host stops sending the clock during an ongoing transaction.

regs.name: INTR_ENABLE
regs.desc: Interrupt Enable Register

fields.name: FMT_THRESHOLD
fields.desc: Enable interrupt when !!INTR_STATE.fmt_threshold is set.

fields.name: RX_THRESHOLD
fields.desc: Enable interrupt when !!INTR_STATE.rx_threshold is set.

fields.name: ACQ_THRESHOLD
fields.desc: Enable interrupt when !!INTR_STATE.acq_threshold is set.

fields.name: RX_OVERFLOW
fields.desc: Enable interrupt when !!INTR_STATE.rx_overflow is set.

fields.name: CONTROLLER_HALT
fields.desc: Enable interrupt when !!INTR_STATE.controller_halt is set.

fields.name: SCL_INTERFERENCE
fields.desc: Enable interrupt when !!INTR_STATE.scl_interference is set.

fields.name: SDA_INTERFERENCE
fields.desc: Enable interrupt when !!INTR_STATE.sda_interference is set.

fields.name: STRETCH_TIMEOUT
fields.desc: Enable interrupt when !!INTR_STATE.stretch_timeout is set.

fields.name: SDA_UNSTABLE
fields.desc: Enable interrupt when !!INTR_STATE.sda_unstable is set.

fields.name: CMD_COMPLETE
fields.desc: Enable interrupt when !!INTR_STATE.cmd_complete is set.

fields.name: TX_STRETCH
fields.desc: Enable interrupt when !!INTR_STATE.tx_stretch is set.

fields.name: TX_THRESHOLD
fields.desc: Enable interrupt when !!INTR_STATE.tx_threshold is set.

fields.name: ACQ_STRETCH
fields.desc: Enable interrupt when !!INTR_STATE.acq_stretch is set.

fields.name: UNEXP_STOP
fields.desc: Enable interrupt when !!INTR_STATE.unexp_stop is set.

fields.name: HOST_TIMEOUT
fields.desc: Enable interrupt when !!INTR_STATE.host_timeout is set.

regs.name: INTR_TEST
regs.desc: Interrupt Test Register

fields.name: FMT_THRESHOLD
fields.desc: Write 1 to force !!INTR_STATE.fmt_threshold to 1.

fields.name: RX_THRESHOLD
fields.desc: Write 1 to force !!INTR_STATE.rx_threshold to 1.

fields.name: ACQ_THRESHOLD
fields.desc: Write 1 to force !!INTR_STATE.acq_threshold to 1.

fields.name: RX_OVERFLOW
fields.desc: Write 1 to force !!INTR_STATE.rx_overflow to 1.

fields.name: CONTROLLER_HALT
fields.desc: Write 1 to force !!INTR_STATE.controller_halt to 1.

fields.name: SCL_INTERFERENCE
fields.desc: Write 1 to force !!INTR_STATE.scl_interference to 1.

fields.name: SDA_INTERFERENCE
fields.desc: Write 1 to force !!INTR_STATE.sda_interference to 1.

fields.name: STRETCH_TIMEOUT
fields.desc: Write 1 to force !!INTR_STATE.stretch_timeout to 1.

fields.name: SDA_UNSTABLE
fields.desc: Write 1 to force !!INTR_STATE.sda_unstable to 1.

fields.name: CMD_COMPLETE
fields.desc: Write 1 to force !!INTR_STATE.cmd_complete to 1.

fields.name: TX_STRETCH
fields.desc: Write 1 to force !!INTR_STATE.tx_stretch to 1.

fields.name: TX_THRESHOLD
fields.desc: Write 1 to force !!INTR_STATE.tx_threshold to 1.

fields.name: ACQ_STRETCH
fields.desc: Write 1 to force !!INTR_STATE.acq_stretch to 1.

fields.name: UNEXP_STOP
fields.desc: Write 1 to force !!INTR_STATE.unexp_stop to 1.

fields.name: HOST_TIMEOUT
fields.desc: Write 1 to force !!INTR_STATE.host_timeout to 1.

regs.name: CTRL
regs.desc: I2C Control Register

fields.name: ENABLEHOST
fields.desc: Enable Host I2C functionality

fields.name: ENABLETARGET
fields.desc: Enable Target I2C functionality

fields.name: LLPBK
fields.desc: Enable I2C line loopback testIf line loopback is enabled, the internal design sees ACQ and RX data as "1"

fields.name: NACK_ADDR_AFTER_TIMEOUT
fields.desc: Enable NACKing the address on a stretch timeout.This is a Target mode feature.If enabled (1), a stretch timeout will cause the device to NACK the address byte.If disabled (0), a stretch timeout will cause the device to ACK the address byte.SMBus requires that devices always ACK their address, even for read commands.However, non-SMBus protocols may have a different approach and can choose to NACK instead.Note that both cases handle data bytes the same way.For writes, the Target module will NACK all subsequent data bytes until it receives a Stop.For reads, the Target module will release SDA, causing 0xff to be returned for all data bytes until it receives a Stop.

fields.name: ACK_CTRL_EN
fields.desc: Enable I2C Target ACK Control Mode.ACK Control Mode works together with !!TARGET_ACK_CTRL.NBYTES to allow software to control upper-layer protocol (N)ACKing (e.g. as in SMBus).This bit enables the mode when 1, and !!TARGET_ACK_CTRL.NBYTES limits how many bytes may be automatically ACK'd while the ACQ FIFO has space.If it is 0, the decision to ACK or NACK is made only from stretching timeouts and !!CTRL.NACK_ADDR_AFTER_TIMEOUT.

fields.name: MULTI_CONTROLLER_MONITOR_EN
fields.desc: Enable the bus monitor in multi-controller mode.If a 0->1 transition happens while !!CTRL.ENABLEHOST and !!CTRL.ENABLETARGET are both 0, the bus monitor will enable and begin in the "bus busy" state.To transition to a bus free state, !!HOST_TIMEOUT_CTRL must be nonzero, so the bus monitor may count out idle cycles to confirm the freedom to transmit.In addition, the bus monitor will track whether the bus is free based on the enabled timeouts and detected Stop symbols.For multi-controller mode, ensure !!CTRL.MULTI_CONTROLLER_MONITOR_EN becomes 1 no later than !!CTRL.ENABLEHOST or !!CTRL.ENABLETARGET.This bit can be set at the same time as either or both of the other two, though.Note that if !!CTRL.MULTI_CONTROLLER_MONITOR_EN is set after !!CTRL.ENABLEHOST or !!CTRL.ENABLETARGET, the bus monitor will begin in the "bus free" state instead.This would violate the proper protocol for a controller to join a multi-controller environment.However, if this controller is known to be the first to join, this ordering will enable skipping the idle wait.When 0, the bus monitor will report that the bus is always free, so the controller FSM is never blocked from transmitting.

fields.name: TX_STRETCH_CTRL_EN
fields.desc: If set to 1, this bit causes a read transfer addressed to this target to set the corresponding bit in !!TARGET_EVENTS.While !!TARGET_EVENTS.TX_PENDING is 1, subsequent read transactions will stretch the clock, even if there is data in the TX FIFO.If enabled, this function allows software to confirm the data in the TX FIFO should be released for the current read.This may be useful for cases where the TX FIFO has data that does not apply to the current transfer.For example, the transaction could've targeted an alternate function via another address.

regs.name: STATUS
regs.desc: I2C Live Status Register for Host and Target modes

fields.name: FMTFULL
fields.desc: Host mode FMT FIFO is full

fields.name: RXFULL
fields.desc: Host mode RX FIFO is full

fields.name: FMTEMPTY
fields.desc: Host mode FMT FIFO is empty

fields.name: HOSTIDLE
fields.desc: Host functionality is idle. No Host transaction is in progress

fields.name: TARGETIDLE
fields.desc: Target functionality is idle. No Target transaction is in progress

fields.name: RXEMPTY
fields.desc: Host mode RX FIFO is empty

fields.name: TXFULL
fields.desc: Target mode TX FIFO is full

fields.name: ACQFULL
fields.desc: Target mode receive FIFO is full

fields.name: TXEMPTY
fields.desc: Target mode TX FIFO is empty

fields.name: ACQEMPTY
fields.desc: Target mode receive FIFO is empty

fields.name: ACK_CTRL_STRETCH
fields.desc: Target mode stretching at (N)ACK phase due to zero count in !!TARGET_ACK_CTRL.NBYTES

regs.name: RDATA
regs.desc: I2C Read Data

regs.name: FDATA
regs.desc: I2C Host Format DataWrites to this register are used to define and drive Controller-Mode transactions.

fields.name: FBYTE
fields.desc: Format Byte.If no flags are set, hardware will transmit this byte directly.If READB is set, this field becomes the number of bytes hardware will automaticallyread from the bus.

fields.name: START
fields.desc: Issue a START condition before transmitting FBYTE.

fields.name: STOP
fields.desc: Issue a STOP condition after transmitting FBYTE.

fields.name: READB
fields.desc: Transfer Direction Indicator.If unset, this write to FDATA defines a controller-transmitter operation (WRITE).A single byte of data (FBYTE) is written to the bus.If set, this write to FDATA defines a controller-receiver operation (READ).The value of FBYTE defines the number of bytes read from the bus. (256 if FBYTE==0)"After this number of bytes are read, the final byte will be NACKed to end the transferunless RCONT is also set.

fields.name: RCONT
fields.desc: Do not NACK the last byte read, let the read operation continue.

fields.name: NAKOK
fields.desc: For the currrent controller-transmitter byte (WRITE), do not halt via CONTROLLER_EVENTSor assert the 'controller_halt' interrupt if the current byte is not ACK'd.

regs.name: FIFO_CTRL
regs.desc: I2C FIFO control register

fields.name: RXRST
fields.desc: RX fifo reset. Write 1 to the register resets RX_FIFO. Read returns 0

fields.name: FMTRST
fields.desc: FMT fifo reset. Write 1 to the register resets FMT_FIFO. Read returns 0

fields.name: ACQRST
fields.desc: ACQ FIFO reset. Write 1 to the register resets it. Read returns 0

fields.name: TXRST
fields.desc: TX FIFO reset. Write 1 to the register resets it. Read returns 0

regs.name: HOST_FIFO_CONFIG
regs.desc: Host mode FIFO configuration

fields.name: RX_THRESH
fields.desc: Threshold level for RX interrupts. Whilst the level of data in the RX FIFOis above this setting, the rx_threshold interrupt will be asserted.

fields.name: FMT_THRESH
fields.desc: Threshold level for FMT interrupts. Whilst the number of used entries in theFMT FIFO is below this setting, the fmt_threshold interrupt will be asserted.

regs.name: TARGET_FIFO_CONFIG
regs.desc: Target mode FIFO configuration

fields.name: TX_THRESH
fields.desc: Threshold level for TX interrupts. Whilst the number of used entries in theTX FIFO is below this setting, the tx_threshold interrupt will be asserted.

fields.name: ACQ_THRESH
fields.desc: Threshold level for ACQ interrupts. Whilst the level of data in the ACQ FIFOis above this setting, the acq_threshold interrupt will be asserted.

regs.name: HOST_FIFO_STATUS
regs.desc: Host mode FIFO status register

fields.name: FMTLVL
fields.desc: Current fill level of FMT fifo

fields.name: RXLVL
fields.desc: Current fill level of RX fifo

regs.name: TARGET_FIFO_STATUS
regs.desc: Target mode FIFO status register

fields.name: TXLVL
fields.desc: Current fill level of TX fifo

fields.name: ACQLVL
fields.desc: Current fill level of ACQ fifo

regs.name: OVRD
regs.desc: I2C Override Control Register

fields.name: TXOVRDEN
fields.desc: Override the SDA and SCL TX signals.

fields.name: SCLVAL
fields.desc: Value for SCL Override. Set to 0 to drive TX Low, and set to 1 for high-Z

fields.name: SDAVAL
fields.desc: Value for SDA Override. Set to 0 to drive TX Low, and set to 1 for high-Z

regs.name: VAL
regs.desc: Oversampled RX values

fields.name: SCL_RX
fields.desc: Last 16 oversampled values of SCL. Most recent bit is bit 0, oldest 15.

fields.name: SDA_RX
fields.desc: Last 16 oversampled values of SDA. Most recent bit is bit 16, oldest 31.

regs.name: TIMING0
regs.desc: Detailed I2C Timings (directly corresponding to table 10 in the I2C Specification).All values are expressed in units of the input clock period.These must be greater than 2 in order for the change in SCL to propagate to the input of the FSM so that acknowledgements are detected correctly.

fields.name: THIGH
fields.desc: The actual time to hold SCL high in a given pulse.This field is sized to have a range of at least Standard Mode's 4.0 us max with a core clock at 1 GHz.

fields.name: TLOW
fields.desc: The actual time to hold SCL low between any two SCL pulses.This field is sized to have a range of at least Standard Mode's 4.7 us max with a core clock at 1 GHz.

regs.name: TIMING1
regs.desc: Detailed I2C Timings (directly corresponding to table 10 in the I2C Specification).All values are expressed in units of the input clock period.

fields.name: T_R
fields.desc: The nominal rise time to anticipate for the bus (depends on capacitance).This field is sized to have a range of at least Standard Mode's 1000 ns max with a core clock at 1 GHz.

fields.name: T_F
fields.desc: The nominal fall time to anticipate for the bus (influences SDA hold times).This field is sized to have a range of at least Standard Mode's 300 ns max with a core clock at 1 GHz.

regs.name: TIMING2
regs.desc: Detailed I2C Timings (directly corresponding to table 10 in the I2C Specification).All values are expressed in units of the input clock period.

fields.name: TSU_STA
fields.desc: Actual setup time for repeated start signals.This field is sized to have a range of at least Standard Mode's 4.7 us max with a core clock at 1 GHz.

fields.name: THD_STA
fields.desc: Actual hold time for start signals.This field is sized to have a range of at least Standard Mode's 4.0 us max with a core clock at 1 GHz.

regs.name: TIMING3
regs.desc: Detailed I2C Timings (directly corresponding to table 10, in the I2C Specification).All values are expressed in units of the input clock period.

fields.name: TSU_DAT
fields.desc: Actual setup time for data (or ack) bits.This field is sized to have a range of at least Standard Mode's 250 ns max with a core clock at 1 GHz.

fields.name: THD_DAT
fields.desc: Actual hold time for data (or ack) bits.(Note, where required, the parameters TVD_DAT is taken to be THD_DAT+T_F)This field is sized to have a range that accommodates Standard Mode's 3.45 us max for TVD_DAT with a core clock at 1 GHz.However, this field is generally expected to represent a time substantially shorter than that.It should be long enough to cover the maximum round-trip latency from output pins, through pads and voltage transitions on the board, and back to the input pins, but it should not be substantially greater.

regs.name: TIMING4
regs.desc: Detailed I2C Timings (directly corresponding to table 10, in the I2C Specification).All values are expressed in units of the input clock period.

fields.name: TSU_STO
fields.desc: Actual setup time for stop signals.This field is sized to have a range of at least Standard Mode's 4.0 us max with a core clock at 1 GHz.

fields.name: T_BUF
fields.desc: Actual time between each STOP signal and the following START signal.This field is sized to have a range of at least Standard Mode's 4.7 us max with a core clock at 1 GHz.

regs.name: TIMEOUT_CTRL
regs.desc: I2C clock stretching and bus timeout control.This timeout must be enabled by setting !!TIMEOUT_CTRL.EN to 1, and the behavior of this feature depends on the value of !!TIMEOUT_CTRL.MODE.If the mode is "STRETCH_TIMEOUT", this is used in I2C controller mode to detect whether a connected target is stretching a single low time beyond the timeout value.Configured as such, this timeout is more informative and doesn't do more than assert the "stretch_timeout" interrupt.If the mode is "BUS_TIMEOUT", it is used to detect whether the clock has been held low for too long instead, inclusive of the controller's clock low time.This is useful for an SMBus context, where the VAL programmed should be tTIMEOUT:MIN.

fields.name: VAL
fields.desc: Clock stretching timeout value (in units of input clock frequency)

fields.name: MODE
fields.desc: Selects the timeout mode, between a stretch timeout and a bus timeout.Between the two modes, the primary difference is how much of the clock low period is counted.For a stretch timeout, only the time that another device holds the clock low will be counted.For a bus timeout, the entire clock low time is counted, consistent with the SMBus tTIMEOUT type.!!TIMEOUT_CTRL.EN must be 1 for either of these features to be enabled.

fields.name: EN
fields.desc: Enable stretch timeout or bus timeout feature

regs.name: TARGET_ID
regs.desc: I2C target address and mask pairs

fields.name: ADDRESS0
fields.desc: I2C target address number 0

fields.name: MASK0
fields.desc: I2C target mask number 0.At least one bit in MASK0 must be set to 1 for ADDRESS0 to be used.

fields.name: ADDRESS1
fields.desc: I2C target address number 1

fields.name: MASK1
fields.desc: I2C target mask number 1.At least one bit in MASK1 must be set to 1 for ADDRESS1 to be used.

regs.name: ACQDATA
regs.desc: I2C target acquired data

fields.name: ABYTE
fields.desc: Address for accepted transaction or acquired byte

fields.name: SIGNAL
fields.desc: Indicates any control symbols associated with the ABYTE.For the STOP symbol, a stretch timeout or other unexpected events will cause a NACK_STOP to appear in the ACQ FIFO.If the ACQ FIFO doesn't have enough space to record a START and a STOP, the transaction will be dropped entirely on a stretch timeout.In that case, the START byte will not appear (neither as START nor NACK_START), but a standalone NACK_STOP may, if there was space.Software can discard any standalone NACK_STOP that appears.See the associated values for more information about the contents.

regs.name: TXDATA
regs.desc: I2C target transmit data

regs.name: HOST_TIMEOUT_CTRL
regs.desc: I2C host clock generation timeout value (in units of input clock frequency).In an active transaction in Target-Mode, if the Controller ceases to send SCL pulsesfor this number of cycles then the "host_timeout" interrupt will be asserted.In multi-controller monitoring mode, !!HOST_TIMEOUT_CTRL is required to be nonzero to transition out of the initial busy state.Set this CSR to 0 to disable this behaviour.

regs.name: TARGET_TIMEOUT_CTRL
regs.desc: I2C target internal stretching timeout control.When the target has stretched beyond this time it will send a NACK for incoming data bytes or release SDA for outgoing data bytes.The behavior for the address byte is configurable via !!CTRL.ACK_ADDR_AFTER_TIMEOUT.Note that the count accumulates stretching time over the course of a transaction.In other words, this is equivalent to the SMBus cumulative target clock extension time.

fields.name: VAL
fields.desc: Clock stretching timeout value (in units of input clock frequency)

fields.name: EN
fields.desc: Enable timeout feature and send NACK once the timeout has been reached

regs.name: TARGET_NACK_COUNT
regs.desc: Number of times the I2C target has NACK'ed a new transaction since the last read of this register.Reading this register clears it.This is useful because when the ACQ FIFO is full the software know that a NACK has occurred, but without this register would not know how many transactions it missed.When it reaches its maximum value it will stay at that value.

regs.name: TARGET_ACK_CTRL
regs.desc: Controls for mid-transfer (N)ACK phase handling

fields.name: NBYTES
fields.desc: Remaining number of bytes the Target module may ACK automatically.If !!CTRL.ACK_CTRL_EN is set to 1, the Target module will stretch the clock at the (N)ACK phase of a byte if this CSR is 0, awaiting software's instructions.At the beginning of each Write transfer, this byte count is reset to 0.Writes to this CSR also are only accepted while the Target module is stretching the clock.The Target module will always ACK its address if the ACQ FIFO has space.For data bytes afterwards, it will stop at the (N)ACK phase and stretch the clock when this CSR is 0.For each data byte that is ACK'd in a transaction, the byte count will decrease by 1.Note that a full ACQ FIFO can still cause the Target module to halt at the beginning of a new byte.The ACK Control Mode provides an additional synchronization point, during the (N)ACK phase instead of after.For both cases, !!TARGET_TIMEOUT_CTRL applies, and stretching past the timeout will produce an automatic NACK.This mode can be used to implement the mid-transfer (N)ACK responses required by various SMBus protocols.

fields.name: NACK
fields.desc: When the Target module stretches on the (N)ACK phase of a Write due to !!TARGET_ACK_CTRL.NBYTES being 0, writing a 1 here will cause it to send a NACK.If software chooses to NACK, note that the NACKing behavior is the same as if a stretch timeout occurred.The rest of the transaction will be NACK'd, including subsequent transfers.For the address byte, the (N)ACK phase of subsequent transfers will follow the behavior specified by !!CTRL.NACK_ADDR_AFTER_TIMEOUT.Automatically clears to 0.

regs.name: ACQ_FIFO_NEXT_DATA
regs.desc: The data byte pending to be written to the ACQ FIFO.This CSR is only valid while the Target module is stretching in the (N)ACK phase, indicated by !!STATUS.ACK_CTRL_STRETCH .It is intended to be used with ACK Control Mode, so software may check the current byte.

regs.name: HOST_NACK_HANDLER_TIMEOUT
regs.desc: Timeout in Host-Mode for an unhandled NACK before hardware automatically ends the transaction.(in units of input clock frequency)If an active Controller-Transmitter transfer receives a NACK from the Target, the !!CONTROLLER_EVENTS.NACK bit is set.In turn, this causes the Controller FSM to halt awaiting software intervention, and the 'controller_halt' interrupt may assert.Software must clear the !!CONTROLLER_EVENTS.NACK bit to allow the state machine to continue, typically after clearing out the FMTFIFO to start a new transfer.While halted, the active transaction is not ended (no STOP (P) condition is created), and the block asserts SCL and leaves SDA released.This timeout can be used to automatically produce a STOP condition, whether as a backstop for slow software responses (longer timeout) or as a convenience (short timeout).If the timeout expires, the Controller FSM will issue a STOP (P) condition on the bus to end the active transaction.Additionally, the !!CONTROLLER_EVENTS.UNHANDLED_NACK_TIMEOUT bit is set to alert software, and the FSM will return to the idle state and halt until the bit is cleared.The enable bit must be set for this feature to operate.

fields.name: VAL
fields.desc: Unhandled NAK timeout value (in units of input clock frequency)

fields.name: EN
fields.desc: Timeout enable

regs.name: CONTROLLER_EVENTS
regs.desc: Latched events that explain why the controller halted.Any bits that are set must be written (with a 1) to clear the CONTROLLER_HALT interrupt.

fields.name: NACK
fields.desc: Received an unexpected NACK

fields.name: UNHANDLED_NACK_TIMEOUT
fields.desc: A Host-Mode active transaction has been ended by the !!HOST_NACK_HANDLER_TIMEOUT mechanism.

fields.name: BUS_TIMEOUT
fields.desc: A Host-Mode active transaction has terminated due to a bus timeout activated by !!TIMEOUT_CTRL.

fields.name: ARBITRATION_LOST
fields.desc: A Host-Mode active transaction has terminated due to lost arbitration.

regs.name: TARGET_EVENTS
regs.desc: Latched events that can cause the target module to stretch the clock at the beginning of a read transfer.These events cause TX FIFO-related stretching even when the TX FIFO has data available.Any bits that are set must be written (with a 1) to clear the tx_stretch interrupt.This CSR serves as a gate to prevent the Target module from responding to a read command with unrelated, leftover data.

fields.name: TX_PENDING
fields.desc: A new Target-Mode read transfer has arrived that addressed this target.This bit is used by software to confirm the release of the contents in the TX FIFO.If the contents do not apply, software should first reset the TX FIFO, then load it with the correct data, then clear this bit.Optionally enabled by !!CTRL.TX_STRETCH_CTRL_EN.

fields.name: BUS_TIMEOUT
fields.desc: A Target-Mode read transfer has terminated due to a bus timeout activated by !!TIMEOUT_CTRL.

fields.name: ARBITRATION_LOST
fields.desc: A Target-Mode read transfer has terminated due to lost arbitration.

regs.name: INTR_STATE
regs.desc: Interrupt State Register

fields.name: RX_FULL
fields.desc: Receive FIFO is full

fields.name: RX_WATERMARK
fields.desc: Receive FIFO level is at or above watermark

fields.name: TX_EMPTY
fields.desc: Transmit FIFO is empty

fields.name: TX_WATERMARK
fields.desc: Transmit FIFO level is at or below watermark

fields.name: COMPLETE
fields.desc: On-going SPI operation has completed and the block is now idle

regs.name: INTR_ENABLE
regs.desc: Interrupt Enable Register

fields.name: RX_FULL
fields.desc: Enable interrupt when !!INTR_STATE.rx_full is set.

fields.name: RX_WATERMARK
fields.desc: Enable interrupt when !!INTR_STATE.rx_watermark is set.

fields.name: TX_EMPTY
fields.desc: Enable interrupt when !!INTR_STATE.tx_empty is set.

fields.name: TX_WATERMARK
fields.desc: Enable interrupt when !!INTR_STATE.tx_watermark is set.

fields.name: COMPLETE
fields.desc: Enable interrupt when !!INTR_STATE.complete is set.

regs.name: INTR_TEST
regs.desc: Interrupt Test Register

fields.name: RX_FULL
fields.desc: Write 1 to force !!INTR_STATE.rx_full to 1.

fields.name: RX_WATERMARK
fields.desc: Write 1 to force !!INTR_STATE.rx_watermark to 1.

fields.name: TX_EMPTY
fields.desc: Write 1 to force !!INTR_STATE.tx_empty to 1.

fields.name: TX_WATERMARK
fields.desc: Write 1 to force !!INTR_STATE.tx_watermark to 1.

fields.name: COMPLETE
fields.desc: Write 1 to force !!INTR_STATE.complete to 1.

regs.name: CFG
regs.desc: Configuration register. Controls how the SPI block transmits   and receives data. This register can only be modified   whilst the SPI block is idle.

fields.name: HALF_CLK_PERIOD
fields.desc: The length of a half period (i.e. positive edge to negative   edge) of the SPI clock, measured in system clock cycles   reduced by 1. At the standard Sonata 50 MHz system clock a   value of 0 gives a 25 MHz SPI clock, a value of 1 gives a   12.5 MHz SPI clock, a value of 2 gives a 8.33 MHz SPI clock   and so on.

fields.name: COPI_IDLE
fields.desc: State of the controller output line (COPI) when not transmitting.

fields.name: MSB_FIRST
fields.desc: When set the most significant bit (MSB) is the first bit   sent and received with each byte

fields.name: CPHA
fields.desc: The phase of the spi_clk signal. When CPHA is 0 data is   sampled on the leading edge and changes on the trailing   edge. The first data bit is immediately available before   the first leading edge of the clock when transmission   begins. When CPHA is 1 data is sampled on the trailing edge   and change on the leading edge.

fields.name: CPOL
fields.desc: The polarity of the spi_clk signal. When CPOL is 0 clock is   low when idle and the leading edge is positive. When CPOL   is 1 clock is high when idle and the leading edge is   negative

regs.name: CONTROL
regs.desc: Controls the operation of the SPI block. This register can   only be modified whilst the SPI block is idle.

fields.name: TX_CLEAR
fields.desc: Write 1 to clear the transmit FIFO

fields.name: RX_CLEAR
fields.desc: Write 1 to clear the receive FIFO

fields.name: TX_ENABLE
fields.desc: When set bytes from the transmit FIFO are sent. When clear   the state of the outgoing spi_copi is undefined whilst the   SPI clock is running.

fields.name: RX_ENABLE
fields.desc: When set incoming bits are written to the receive FIFO.   When clear incoming bits are ignored.

fields.name: TX_WATERMARK
fields.desc: The watermark level for the transmit FIFO, depending on the   value the interrupt will trigger at different points:    * 0 - 1 or fewer items in the FIFO    * 1 - 2 or fewer items in the FIFO    * 2 - 4 or fewer items in the FIFO    * 3 - 8 or fewer items in the FIFO    * 4 - 16 or fewer items in the FIFO

fields.name: RX_WATERMARK
fields.desc: The watermark level for the receive FIFO, depending on the   value the interrupt will trigger at different points:    * 0 - 1 or more items in the FIFO    * 1 - 2 or more items in the FIFO    * 2 - 4 or more items in the FIFO    * 3 - 8 or more items in the FIFO    * 4 - 16 or more items in the FIFO    * 5 - 32 or more items in the FIFO    * 6 - 56 or more items in the FIFO

fields.name: INT_LOOPBACK
fields.desc: When set the CIPO line is internally connected to the COPI line,   providing loopback functionality which may be useful in testing.   Note that the COPI line is unaffected and still carries data so   test software should normally leave the CS lines deasserted.   This bit shall be changed only when the SPI core is idle.

fields.name: SW_RESET
fields.desc: When a 1 is written to this field a reset of the controller logic   is performed.   This shall be used only to recover from error conditions.   The TX FIFO shall be cleared before resetting the controller logic;   then clear the RX FIFO after the controller reset.   The bit self-clears and always reads as zero.

regs.name: STATUS
regs.desc: Status information about the SPI block

fields.name: TX_FIFO_LEVEL
fields.desc: Number of items in the transmit FIFO

fields.name: RX_FIFO_LEVEL
fields.desc: Number of items in the receive FIFO

fields.name: TX_FIFO_FULL
fields.desc: When set the transmit FIFO is full and any data written to it   will be ignored.

fields.name: RX_FIFO_EMPTY
fields.desc: When set the receive FIFO is empty and any data read from it   will be undefined.

fields.name: IDLE
fields.desc: When set the SPI block is idle and can accept a new start   command.

regs.name: START
regs.desc: When written begins an SPI operation. Writes are ignored when the   SPI block is active.

fields.name: BYTE_COUNT
fields.desc: Number of bytes to receive/transmit in the SPI operation

regs.name: RX_FIFO
regs.desc: Data from the receive FIFO. When read the data is popped from the   FIFO. If the FIFO is empty data read is undefined.

fields.name: DATA
fields.desc: Byte popped from the FIFO

regs.name: TX_FIFO
regs.desc: Bytes written here are pushed to the transmit FIFO. If the FIFO   is full writes are ignored.

fields.name: DATA
fields.desc: Byte to push to the FIFO

regs.name: INFO
regs.desc: Returns information on the SPI controller.

fields.name: TX_FIFO_DEPTH
fields.desc: Maximum number of items in the transmit FIFO.

fields.name: RX_FIFO_DEPTH
fields.desc: Maximum number of items in the receive FIFO.

regs.name: CS
regs.desc: Specifies which peripherals are selected for transmit/receive operations.   An operation may select multiple peripherals simultaneously but this functionality   shall be used only for transmit operations.   This register shall be changed only when the SPI controller is idle, not whilst   a transmit/receive operation may be in progress.

fields.name: CS_0
fields.desc: If this bit is clear the peripheral is selected for transmit/receive operations.

fields.name: CS_1
fields.desc: If this bit is clear the peripheral is selected for transmit/receive operations.

fields.name: CS_2
fields.desc: If this bit is clear the peripheral is selected for transmit/receive operations.

fields.name: CS_3
fields.desc: If this bit is clear the peripheral is selected for transmit/receive operations.

regs.desc: Interrupt State Register

fields.name: RX_FULL
fields.desc: Receive FIFO is full

fields.name: RX_WATERMARK
fields.desc: Receive FIFO level is at or above watermark

fields.name: TX_EMPTY
fields.desc: Transmit FIFO is empty

fields.name: TX_WATERMARK
fields.desc: Transmit FIFO level is at or below watermark

fields.name: COMPLETE
fields.desc: On-going SPI operation has completed and the block is now idle

regs.name: INTR_ENABLE
regs.desc: Interrupt Enable Register

fields.name: RX_FULL
fields.desc: Enable interrupt when !!INTR_STATE.rx_full is set.

fields.name: RX_WATERMARK
fields.desc: Enable interrupt when !!INTR_STATE.rx_watermark is set.

fields.name: TX_EMPTY
fields.desc: Enable interrupt when !!INTR_STATE.tx_empty is set.

fields.name: TX_WATERMARK
fields.desc: Enable interrupt when !!INTR_STATE.tx_watermark is set.

fields.name: COMPLETE
fields.desc: Enable interrupt when !!INTR_STATE.complete is set.

regs.name: INTR_TEST
regs.desc: Interrupt Test Register

fields.name: RX_FULL
fields.desc: Write 1 to force !!INTR_STATE.rx_full to 1.

fields.name: RX_WATERMARK
fields.desc: Write 1 to force !!INTR_STATE.rx_watermark to 1.

fields.name: TX_EMPTY
fields.desc: Write 1 to force !!INTR_STATE.tx_empty to 1.

fields.name: TX_WATERMARK
fields.desc: Write 1 to force !!INTR_STATE.tx_watermark to 1.

fields.name: COMPLETE
fields.desc: Write 1 to force !!INTR_STATE.complete to 1.
